description: This is a supervised dissertation that allows students to consolidate and extend the knowledge and skills acquired during the coursework and apply these in a scientific way in the environmental health context. This dissertation can form the basis of a paper publishable in a national or international journal.
prerequisites: Have completed 8 units of coursework, including 4 units of Part A courses, with a minimum Grade Point Average (GPA) of 5.5
restricted: Master of Environmental Health Sciences students
